doc.field: Le Matin, the French-language tabloid launched here in February, said it is shutting down its operations because it can no longer get financing. The paper, launched by private investors, was Montreal's fourth French-language newspaper and was aimed at readers with above average incomes and educations. It had a daily circulation of about 20,000 copies. Le Matin was printed and distributed by (Southam Inc)'s Montreal Gazette newspaper. A Gazette spokesman said his newspaper is Le Matin's biggest creditor but he declined to reveal the amount of debt Acting publisher Jean-Pierre Bordua said the newspaper's bank blocked its lines of credit after three of the paper's senior managers resigned Friday. Reuter
